Complete the code in python to solve this programming problem:

Description: $$$m$$$ chairs are arranged in a circle sequentially. The chairs are numbered from $$$0$$$ to $$$m-1$$$. $$$n$$$ people want to sit in these chairs such that each person has at least $$$a[i]$$$ empty chairs both on his right and left side. More formally, the $$$i$$$-th person has at least $$$a[i]$$$ empty chairs both on his right and left side. Decide if it is possible to sit all of the people, under the given limitations.

Input Specification: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 5 \cdot 10^4$$$) denoting the number of test cases. The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$m$$ ($$$2 \leq n \leq 10^5$$, $$$1 \leq m \leq 10^9$$$) denoting the number of people and the number of chairs. The next line contains $$$n$$$ integers, $$$a_1$$$, $$$a_2$$$, ..., $$$a_n$$ ($$$1 \leq a_i \leq 10^9$$$) denoting the minimum number of empty chairs on both sides of the $$$i$$$-th person.

Output Specification: For each test case, print "YES" if it is possible to sit all of the people, and "NO" otherwise. You may print the answer in any case (for example, "yEs", "YES", "yes", "NO", etc.).
